intro: Wilbrandia ebracteata, commonly known as the glassy star or glassy starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other familiar plants like evening primroses and willows. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Wilbrandia ebracteata thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
